# NSMenuItemBadge

**Class**

A control that provides additional quantitative information specific to a menu item, such as the number of available updates.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSMenuItemBadge
```

## Overview

You create a badge using an initializer or a predefined factory method, and then you assign it to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItem/badge] property of a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItem] for display.



For example, to display a badge with a count, use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItemBadge/init(count:)] initalizer, passing in the value of `count` as an `Int`.



To display a badge with a custom string, use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItemBadge/init(string:)] initializer, passing in the string you want to display.



To display a badge using a predefined [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItemBadge/BadgeType], use a factory method such as [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuItemBadge/newItems(count:)], passing in the `count` of the badge to display.





The default value of this property is `nil`.

## Creating menu item badges

- **init(count:)**: Creates a badge with a count and an empty string.
- **init(string:)**: Creates a badge with the provided custom string.

## Creating badges of a specific type

- **alerts(count:)**: Creates an alert-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of alerts.
- **newItems(count:)**: Creates a new item-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of new items.
- **updates(count:)**: Creates an update-style badge with an integer count and a predefined label that represents the number of available updates.
- **NSMenuItemBadge.BadgeType**: Constants that define types of badges for display.

## Accessing menu item badge attributes

- **itemCount**: The number of items the badge displays.
- **stringValue**: The string representation of the badge when it displays.
- **type**: The type of items the badge displays.

## Instance Properties

- **stringValue**: The string representation of the badge as it would appear when the badge is displayed.

## Menus

- **NSMenu**: An object that manages an app’s menus.
- **NSMenuItem**: A command item in an app menu.
- **NSMenuDelegate**: The optional methods implemented by delegates of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenu] objects to manage menu display and handle some events.
